title: Ticket #4569: Debugging tools for JobRouter.
description:
We've received strong feedback from OSG site admins that the job router is quite difficult to debug. We'd like to see some client tools to help analyze setups.

Suggestions we've received:

  1. Have a tool which can print all the routes (with or without defaults) and warn about any syntax errors (people often forget line continuations).
  2. Have a tool which can print all jobs matching the umbrella requirements and, for each job, print the route names which match.
  3. Given a single job�and a route name, determine whether the job passes the umbrella requirements, passes the route requirements, and print the changes the router would make.
remarks:
2014-Sep-08 10:57:18 by bbockelm:
To help motivate why we ask for these tools, I include Bob Ball's notes from deploying the HTCondor-CE:

https://www.aglt2.org/wiki/bin/view/AGLT2/CondorCE

Not all bullet-points result in bugs or work item - but I hope it'll give an flavor of what a knowledgable sysadmin finds confusing.

2014-Sep-18 10:17:36 by johnkn:
[41163] provides a way to

  • Print all routes with defaults. There is currently no way to show routes without defaults because that would require non-trivial changes to the way the JobRouter class works. Use the command 
    condor_job_router_tool -config
  • Given a file of job ads, print umbrella requirements, which jobs match umbrella requirements and a random route that the job might be given. (i.e. run the round-robin routing algorithm and print the result). Use the command 
    condor_job_router_tool -match -job <file-of-job-ads>

[41166] enhances the above (on master branch only) to do

  • Given a file of job ads, print the above, and also print all routes that match each job (this breaks down if the number of job ads in the file exceeds the routing limit of any route).

2014-Sep-18 10:21:57 by bbockelm:
Is it possible to, instead of a file, point the tool at jobs in a schedd?

As a "poor man's" version, maybe just give an example in the "-help" output on how to pipe the output from condor_q into this tool?
